xmp

Class XmpHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • xmp.XmpHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandler

    public class XmpHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandler
    Handles XMP metadata extraction from the raw XMP payload (an XML packet). This payload can be sourced from various file types, including JPEG (APP1 segment), TIFF, WebP, PNG, and DNG. c:\apps\exiftool-13.36_64>exiftool -XMP:All -a -u -g1 pool19.JPG ---- XMP-x ---- XMP Toolkit : Image::ExifTool 13.29 ---- XMP-rdf ---- About : uuid:faf5bdd5-ba3d-11da-ad31-d33d75182f1b ---- XMP-dc ---- Creator : Gemma Emily Maggs Description : Trevor Title : Trevor ---- XMP-exif ---- Date/Time Original : 2011:10:07 22:59:20 ---- XMP-xmp ---- Create Date : 2011:10:07 22:59:20 Modify Date : 2011:10:07 22:59:20
    Since:
    27 August 2025
    Version:
    1.8
    Author:
    Trevor

      • XmpHandler

        public XmpHandler(byte[] inputData)
           throws ImageReadErrorException
        Constructs a new XmpHandler from a list of XMP segments.
        Parameters:
        inputData - raw XMP segments as a single byte array
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if segments are null, empty, or cannot be parsed

      • parseMetadata

        public boolean parseMetadata()
                      throws ImageReadErrorException
        Parses the stored XMP byte array into an XML Document object.
        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        true when the parsing is successful
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if parsing of the XMP data fails

      • getXmpPropertyValue

        public java.lang.String getXmpPropertyValue(XmpSchema localName)
        Retrieves a single XMP property value by its XmpSchema definition.
        Parameters:
        localName - the XmpSchema constant defining the property
        Returns:
        the extracted value, or empty string if not found

      • testDump

        public void testDump()
        Utility method to dump all properties using the Adobe XMP SDK. This is useful for debugging and validation against the DOM/XPath method.

      • loadNamespaceContext

        private static javax.xml.namespace.NamespaceContext loadNamespaceContext()
        Creates a custom NamespaceContext for use with XPath, mapping XMP prefixes (from NameSpace enum) and the essential RDF prefix to their full URIs. This allows XPath expressions to use standard prefixes, for example: rdf:Description.
        Returns:
        a populated NamespaceContext instance

      • parseXmlFromByte

        private static org.w3c.dom.Document parseXmlFromByte(byte[] payload)
        Parses the XMP byte array into an XML Document object.
        Parameters:
        payload - byte array containing XMP structured data
        Returns:
        the parsed Document, or null if parsing fails

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readPropertyData()
